intro: Strobilanthes lactata, commonly known as the milkweed strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture. The flowers are usually arranged in spikes and come in shades of pink to white, attracting various pollinators.
